dialogues.CRAIG:

[53]Dr. Lester, while I am flattered that you share your feelings with me, I believe perhaps the workplace is not the most suitable environment for this type of discussion. 
[54]Shit.

[56]I gotta go back to work. Yeah, okay. You too. Okay. Bye. 
[57]I just wanted to say hi.  Did you know I still don't know your name or where you work? 
[58]How about this, if I can guess your first name within three tries, you have to come out for a drink with me tonight. 
[59]Great. Buuuhhppaahhhhnnn. . . . . Muhhhahhhhh. . . . . ahhhnnnaaa. . nollltuuukkkaaaaralllll. . . tashabararassssssuuuuusaaaaaaa. . . nnnnnnnaaaaaannnnnnnnncccccceeeeeee Mwaaaaaa. . . . .Mahhhhhkkkkk. . . sssseeeeeen. Maxine?

[62]Oh, Maxine, nobody told me. Maxine, Maxine. It just came out of me like a song, Maxine. A beautiful crazy, song, Maxine. Maxine. Maxine!

Moving differently, thinking differently, feeling differently. Interesting. Would you like to be inside my skin, Craig? Think what I think? Feel what I feel? More than anything. Maxine. It's good in here, Craig. Better than your wildest dreams. 
[88]Hi.

[104]He's an actor. One of the great American actors of the 20th century.

It raises all sorts of philosophical questions about the nature of self, about the existence of the soul. Am I me? Is Malkovich Malkovich? Was the Buddha right, is duality an illusion? Do you see what a can of worms this portal is? I don't think I can go on living my life as I have lived it. There's only one thing to do. Let's get married right away. 
[106]Yes, of course. He's a celebrity.

[117]Me too, babe. 
[118]Okay. Maybe tomorrow.

[120]You weren't you. You were John Malkovich. 
[121]Tomorrow. We're late for Lester.

[123]No thank you sir. It's delicious, though. I just wanted to thank you for the opportunity to work at LesterCorp, but I'm afraid I'm going to have to tender my resignation effectively immediately. 
[124]No sir, not at all. It's just that I'm going to open my own business and... 
[125]Uh, import-export. Olive oil. Right on 7 1/2 actually. In the vacant office. So we'll still be seeing each other.

[131]What, are you nuts? That's Oprah talking. 
[132]This is absurd. Besides Feldman's an allergist. If you're going to do something, do it right.

[134]Yeah, okay. I'll pick you up. 
[135]How was it? 
[136]Why? 
[137]So how was it? What was he doing?

[139]I don't know. There's some tension between us. I'd hate to expose you to that. 
[140]After dinner I'll show you my puppets. 
[141]You? 
[142]My God. 
[143]Come in! 
[144]Please, have a seat. 
[145]Exactly that. We can put you inside someone else's body for fifteen minutes.

[160]And he was with her.

[162]Don't forget me.

[164]I feel that somehow my parents never prepared me to make this particular decision. Not that I blame them. How could they know? Today's world is so complicated. No. I have to go away now. I'm sorry, Lotte. I'm so sorry.

If only, I've been thinking to myself, if only I could actually feel what Malkovich feels, rather than just see what he sees... And then, dare I say it, if only I could control his arms, his legs, his pelvis, and make them do my bidding.

It's just a matter of practice before Malkovich becomes nothing more than another puppet hanging next to my worktable. Coffee?

[213]You'll have me, after all I've done to you? 
[214]I'm through with puppets, Lotte. I just want you to know that. 
[215]I'd like to be a farmer. I want to help things grow, to encourage life. Do you and your friends need a farmer? 
[216]I love you, Lotte.

Look at the way I keep you, locked in cages, for my own enjoyment. Well, I've been in a cage too, my friends. Literally and figuratively. So tonight I set you free.

[52]Hi. I'm so glad you decided to come. I'm Maxine. 
[53]And the funny thing is. Mr. Malkovich, my voice is probably the least intriguing thing about me. 
[54]Whatever you're having. 
[55]Ah. 
[56]The way I see it, the world is divide into those go after what they want and those who don't. The passionate ones, the ones who go after what they want, may not get what they want, but they remain vital, in touch with themselves, and when they lie on their deathbeds, they have few regrets. The ones who don't go after what they want... well, who gives a shit about them anyway? 
[57]Craig, I just don't find you attractive. And, Lotte, I'm smitten with you, but only when you're in Malkovich. When I looked into his eyes last night, I could feel you peering out. Behind the stubble and the too-prominent brow and the male pattern baldness, I sensed your feminine longing peering out, and it just slew me. 
[58]Only to John, sweetie. I'm sorry. Thanks for a wonderful dinner. No hard feelings, partner. 
[59]No. 
[60]No. Don't be an ass. 
[61]You can be John Malkovich. 
[62]Two hundred dollars, please. 
[63]So unbolt the fucking door, Einstein. 
[64]Crackpot. 
[65]Yes? 
[66]When? 
[67]Thanks so much for coming over. 
[68]So, do you enjoy being an actor? 
[69]I love you, Lotte. 
[70]Do you mind? 
[71]Oh, my sweet, beautiful Lotte. 
[72]You're late. 
[73]I've fallen in love. 
[74]You picked the unrequited variety. Very bad for the skin. 
[75]Do you have any idea what its like to have two people look at you with total lust and devotion through the same pair of eyes? No I don't suppose you would. It's quite a thrill, Craig. 
[76]J.M. Inc. Be all that someone else can be. 
[77]Sweetie! Oh, but we can't. It's business hours. I need to keep the membranous tunnel open for paying customers. 
[78]Oooh, doll. I love this new devil-may-care side of you. Alrighty, I'll track down Lover-boy, and I'll see both of you in one hour. Exactamundo. 
[79]Oh, Lotte... Oh, sweetie... 
[80]A girl has a right to glow if she wants. It's in the fucking constitution. 
[81]Lotte, this is so good... 
[82]Lotte? Is that you? 
[83]Oh, Lotte... 
[84]Oh, Dollface, it was just your passion for me taking hold. 
[85]Darling! 
[86]Let him try. 
[87]How the hell would I know? I wasn't a philosophy major. 
[88]J.M. Inc. Be all that someone... 
[89]One hour. 
[90]Really? Well, you know, he's quite good. I'm surprised. Anyway, I have a session with Malkovich I have to attend. I'll speak with you soon. 
[91]I thought so too, doll. I guess we were mistaken. 
[92]I can explain about the portal, darling. 
[93]Oh shut up. Craig, darling are you in there? 
[94]Lotte called me. 
[95]Apparently you can control this Malkovich fellow now. 
[96]I'll say you are. Let's do it on his kitchen table, then make him eat an omelette off of it. 
[97]You still there, sweets? 
[98]Wow. Do a puppet show for me, Craig honey. 
[99]I'd love to see your work. 
[100]That was incredible. You're brilliant! 
[101]You're right, my darling, it's so much more. It's playing with people! 
[102]Stay in him forever? 
[103]Well, we'll have all the money in Malkovich's bank account, plus he still gets acting work occasionally. 
[104]No one would ever have to know its not him. 
[105]Oh, Craiggy, that's brilliant! 
[106]It's okay, my sweet. 
[107]Now excuse us, we have an entertainment legend to create. 
[108]No thanks. 
[109]Vegas. 
[110]This is it, lover. You're stepping onto that stage a nobody and presto-change-o, you're coming back the greatest puppeteer the world has ever seen. 
[111]Doesn't he know how important tonight is to us? 
[112]Oh, darling. It's a dream come true. We're going to ride this straight to the top. 
[113]Busy day, my little fire chief. Why don't you climb into bed, and I'll meet you there in just... 
[114]Bad dream, darling? 
[115]You've got to be kidding. 
[116]Malkovich is our meal ticket. You can't back out because of some stupid dream. 
[117]Perhaps you'll want to consult that Ouija board again. 
[118]Yeah what?! 
[119]I'm Maxine. I produced the evening with Malkovich. 
[120]Yeah, we'll see, Schwartz. We'll see. 
[121]Keep your eyes in your pants, old timer. 
[122]You'd better turn on the pyrotechnics, lover, 'cause right now you're running neck and neck with the dead president. And you're both in last place. 
[123]Whatever.
dialogues.LESTER:
[1]Come in, Mr. Juarez. I'd stand, but, well, you know. 
[2]Security. 
[3]She's not my secretary. She's what they call an executive liaison, and I'm not banging her, if that's what youre implying. 
[4]Tell me, Dr. Schwartz, what do you feel you can bring to LesterCorp? 
[5]You think so, eh? Which comes first, 
[6]Damn, you are good. I tried to trick you. Okay, put these in order. 
[7]Floris, get Guinness on the phone. 
[8]Forget it. 
[9]Fine woman, Floris. I don't know how she puts up with this damn speech impediment of mine. 
[10]Flattery will get you everywhere, my boy. But I'm afraid I have to trust Floris on this one. You see, she has her doctorate in speech impedimentology from Case Western. Perhaps you've read her memoirs, "I can't understand a word any of you are saying." 
[11]Pity, it tells it like it is. That's why the eastern, read Jewish, publishing establishment won't touch it. That's a quote from the book jacket. George Will, I think. I apologize if you can't understan a word I'm saying, Dr. Schwartz. 
[12]Thank you for being kind enough to lie. You see, I've been very lonely in my isolated tower of indecipherable speech. You're hired. Any questions? 
[13]Low overhead, m'boy. We pass the savings on to you. But seriously, that's all covered in orientation. 
[14]Don't toy with Floris, Schwartz. Why, if I were eighty years younger, I'd box your ears. 
[15]One hundred and five. Carrot juice. Lot's of it. I swear, it's almost not worth it. I piss orange. Oh, and I, have to piss sitting down... like a godamn girly... every fifteen minutes. But nobody wants to die, Schwartz. 
[16]No sir-e-bob, I don't die. But what I do is get older, wrinkled like a former plum that's become the wrinkled prune you see before you. Oh, to be a young man again, maybe then Floris would care for me. 
[17]I don't want to be your godamn link, damn you. I want to feel Floris' naked thighs against my own. I want to know passion. I want my body to inspire lust in that beautiful, complex woman. I want her to shiver in a spasm of ecstasy when I penetrate her. Oh, God, the agony of the flesh, Schwartz. 
[18]All right. Meet me at the Juicy-Juice Juice Bar after work today and I'll spill my goddamn guts for you. 
[19]Imagine a room full of women. Nubile, blonde, wet with desire, Schwartz. A harem, if you will. Me in leather. A harness, if you like. I am the object of this desire, and all eyes are on me as I speak. Ladies, I begin. I am the love god, Eros. I intoxicate you. My spunk is to you manna from heaven... 
[20]Wife, huh? I'd love to meet her, Craig. 
[21]Shall we say dinner on Friday. Just the two of us? You can come too if you like, Schwartz. 
[22]Yes? 
[23]Ah, Craig. Just the fellow I wanted to see. Juicer! Easy as pie. Just keep your fingers clear of the blade, and never, never use it while bathing in a tub full of water. 
[24]Ah. yes, the little door. There is a short film on the little door in the orientation room in exactly two minutes. If you hurry, you'll just make it. 
[25]Put up reel 752. 
[26]Tell me, Lotte, can you understand a word I'm saying? 
[27]Oh, be still my heart. 
[28]With immense pleasure, my dear. Down that hall, ninth door on the left. Watch the step down. It's sunken, you know. 
[29]More beet-spinach juice, my friend? 
[30]I see. Are you unhappy at our little company? 
[31]And what sort of business will this be? If you don't mind my asking. 
[32]The vacant office. I see. Olive oil. Interesting. Be warned, Schwartz, there are certain doors which should never be opened. 
[33]You're making a big mistake, Schwartz. Ma'am 
[34]There are rules, boy, procedures, etiquette. This is not a toy. I've been waiting seventy years to utilize this room, grooming myself, quietly setting the stage, performing ablutions, paying tribute, seeing all his motion pictures again and again. Worshipping, Schwartz, worshipping properly. 
[35]I am not alone. There are others. We are legion. You will pay for this blasphemy. You will pay dearly. 
[36]May I have your attention, please. We have a new disciple among us tonight. 
[37]She is the wife of Schwartz. 
[38]No you mustn't, my child. 
[39]We need you on the inside, my child. To report on his comings and goings, and if need be, to... destroy him... ...for lack of a better word. 
[40]Yes, my dear? 
[41]Thank you, Floris. 
[42]Good morning, Lotte! 
[43]You followed your heart, my child, and that is not necessarily a bad thing. 
[44]My child, I don't think its a great mystery what Craig's up to. 
[45]You know I think it pays to leave juice-making to the trained professionals. You look terrible, my dear. 
[46]Hmmm, a lesbian, are you? I must inform you that I find that highly arousing. 
[47]What?! That is not allowed. My God, you are supposed to be one of us. You know you must never partake of Malkovich by yourself! 
[48]Oh, didn't anyone show you the indoctrination video? 
[49]Oh, sorry. Right this way. 
[50]Well, I tried to explain it to her, but... 
[51]Perhaps you're right, Terry. We're all prepared, and perhaps this Schwartz fellow is forcing our hand a bit. We will enter the portal tonight! 
[52]Aaaahhhh, the portal! 
[53]No! Don't harm the vessel! 
[54]I understand, but we must protect the vessel at all costs. Please, Craig, please step aside and allow us to have what is rightfully ours. 
[55]Clear the way for them, my friends. They will be dealt with in due time. 
[56]Now, let's see what we can do to salvage this portal... for the sake of all that is good. 
[57]Well, let's see what we've got here. 
[58]My God, where am I? This seems so familiar. 
[59]My God, I'm Hitler in the bunker! Aaaahhhh! Aaaah! 
[60]Oh, I'm just the actor in that Twilight Zone episode. 
[61]Thank you all for your efforts, but I'm afraid we can no longer get into Malkovich through the portal. 
[62]I'm not certain, my dear, but I believe your husband has somehow psychically diverted the route. 
[63]I'm afraid that no physical harm must come to him as long as he inhabits the vessel. 
[64]Actually, my friends, I suppose its time I told you, I'm Captain James Mertin. 
[65]You see, Lester is an anagram for Mertin. 
[66]It used to work, I'm sure of it. 
[67]Oh, damn it to hell. Anyway, I am. 
[68]I'm two hundred and five, truth be told. 
[69]Lots of carrot juice, little lady. That, and a deal with the Devil. 
[70]Surprise. 
[71]Wait! It's not that bad! When we get into Malkovich, we still get to rule the world, just like I told you. The only difference is that we rule in the name of evil, instead of good. 
[72]Absolutely. 
[73]So anyway... 
[74]My dear, let me assure you that when we attain power, it will be much more pleasant for those inside Malkovich, than for those outside. 
[75]Anybody else? 
[76]But of course. 
[77]Good. I think its time to beckon Mr. Flemmer. Perhaps He can help us out of this pickle. 
[78]And as I said, sir, we can't very well exert physical persuasion upon the sacred vessel Malkovich. 
[79]Didn't mean to imply that you were, sir. 
[80]Blasphemous bastard. 
[81]Pretty good though. 
[82]Not too shabby. 
[83]It's just me, boss. I brought croissants. 
[84]We saw his show at the Luxor last night. 
[85]The kid's got talent. You've never seen Malkovich like this. Schwartz had him up there singing and dancing. Impressions. 
[86]Very talented son of a bitch. Too bad we can't kill him. 
[87]A scary dream? 
[88]I like that. 
[89]How'd it go? Did you say the philodendron gets water or no? 
[90]What kind of circumstances? 
[91]The Great Mantini? 
[92]Oh, he's good! Great, actually. I saw him do "Tru" with his sixty foot Robert Morse puppet. Sensational. 
[93]Do tell. I love a good plan. 
[94]I missed you. I'm sorry. Tell me the plan. 
[95]Can you do that? I mean, do you know anything about puppetry? 
[96]I was just asking. No disrespect intended. 
[97]Fine. I mean, it's not like I was doubting you, it's just that I know puppetry is a skill that takes a long time to acquire. 
[98]Fine. Your mail's on the kitchen table. Mostly junk. Oh, there's a letter from Alex Trebek.
dialogues.MALKOVICH:
[1]The Broadhurst Theater, please. 
[2]Yeah. 
[3]Malkovich. 
[4]Thank you. 
[5]I never played a jewel thief. 
[6]I don't know. 
[7]Yeah, okay. 
[8]So you believe in God... you got something for it? You worked for all the capitalists. You harvested the fruit from your labor? You got God! 
[9]But the past comforts you? The present smiles on you, yes? 
[10]Yeah? 
[11]Who's calling? 
[12]How'd you get this number? 
[13]Listen, this is not amusing. Please don't call here any... Ooh, such authority! NY nipples are at attention, General Malkovich, sir. So I'll be at Bernardo's tonight at eight. Please, please meet me there. I just adored you in that jewel thief movie... 
[14]Yes. 
[15]Thank you very much. 
[16]I'm John. I didn't think I was going to come, but I felt oddly compelled. I have to admit I was a bit intrigued by your voice. 
[17]Can I get you a drink? 
[18]Oh, I'm really glad you called. 
[19]Oh sure. It's very rewarding... 
[20]I'm sorry, did you just call me "Lotte"? 
[21]No, I guess not. I'm an actor. 
[22]Yes, Maxine, yes. 
[23]Tommy, can I take fifteen? 
[24]Maxine... 
[25]Holy shit, yes! 
[26]Holy shit! He said what I said! 
[27]Yes, yes, sweetheart, yes! What the fuck is going on? I'm not talking. This is not me! 
[28]Something was making me talk. Some Goddamn thing was making me move. I gotta get out of here. 
[29]No, Dollface, I know what my passion taking hold feels like. I gotta go. 
[30]It's like nothing I've ever felt before. I think I'm going crazy. 
[31]Kevin, I'm telling you... it was like nothing I've... 
[32]Yes, but you see, someone else was talking through my mouth. 
[33]I think it might've been this Lotte woman talking through me. Maxine likes to call me Lotte. 
[34]I'm done with her now. Tonight really creeped me out. 
[35]I don't know anything about her. What if she's some sort of witch or something? 
[36]I gotta know the truth, Kevin. 
[37]Excuse me, what type of service does this company provide? 
[38]I see. 
[39]Inside. 
[40]What the fuck is going on? 
[41]Simulates? 
[42]Let me try. 
[43]Let me try! 
[44]Jesus. 
[45]Malkovich! 
[46]That... was... no... simulation. 
[47]I have been to the dark side. I have seen a world that no man should ever see. 
[48]This portal is mine and must be sealed up forever. For the love of God. 
[49]It's my head, Schwartz, and I'll see you in court! 
[50]Come on in. 
[51]Don't con me, Maxine. We're over. I just let you up here to tell you that, and to tell you that I'm taking you and Schwartz to court. 
[52]Yes. How did you know it was me? 
[53]Oh, so the bitch escaped. 
[54]I'm getting better all the time. 
[55]No... damn... you... Oh shut up, you overrated sack of shit. 
[56]Yeah. I've figured out how to hold on as long as I want. Oddly enough, it's all in the wrists. 
[57]You mean with Malkovich? 
[58]Really? Yeah. Okay. 
[59]I'll do something I call "Craig's Dance of Despair and Disillusionment." 
[60]You see, Maxine, it isn't just playing with dolls. 
[61]No! But how will we make a living, my love, if our clientele doesn't have access to our product? 
[62]No! Please! Shut up, will you? We're trying to think here. It is sort of like being a puppeteer. I like that about it. 
[63]Wait a minute! What if everybody knew? What if we presented Malkovich as the world's most complicated puppet and me as the only puppeteer sophisticated enough to work him? We'd wipe the floor with the Great Mantini! 
[64]Shut up! Sorry, dear, I lost control for a minute. 
[65]This is my fiancee Maxine. 
[66]I'll get right to the point, Larry. I'm a puppet now... 
[67]I'm being controlled by the world's greatest puppeteer, Craig Schwartz... 
[68]... and I want to show off his skills by performing a one-puppet extravaganza in Reno. 
[69]Vegas. Can you arrange that? 
[70]I'm nervous. Malkovich is fighting me hard today. 
[71]He's a selfish bastard. 
[72]They love me, darling! "Craig Schwartz is fantastic!"  The New York Times. "If only Craig Schwartz had always been inside Malkovich!"  Women's Wear Daily. "Craig Schwartz - The world's greatest puppeteer!"  Paul Wunder, WBAI Radio. 
[73]Sleepy suddenly. 
[74]I've got to leave Malkovich. 
[75]I just had the most horrifying nightmare. The devil was in it. 
[76]Honey, we can be happy and poor together. 
[77]Derek Mantini! 
[78]Did you see the reviews? 
[79]Because if you missed any, I just happen to have copies here you can take with you when you leave now. 
[80]She's not available. 
[81]How do we do that? 
[82]What's the play? 
[83]Never heard of it. 
[84]Sounds boring. Are there any songs? 
[85]I'm not afraid. I toured for a year with the National Puppet Company's production of "Long Day's Journey Into Night." 
[86]Is there dancing? 
[87]Who needs dancing? 
[88]Do you? 
[89]Says who? 
[90]Do you? 
[91]Eyes! ... White eyes -- never closed! Eyes like flames -- coming -- coming! ... God seest! ... God seest! ... NO! 
[92]Good-bye, Maxine. 
[93]I'm back! My nightmare is over. 
[94]I am your earthly king! Kneel before me! 
[95]Greetings, my lowly subjects. 
[96]Boy, be careful what you wish for. Never mind, dear. Just enjoy the ride, will you? 
[97]I am bored. You will dance for your king now. 
[98]Faster! Faster, my little trained monkeys!
dialogues.FLEMMER:
[1]Boy, this is a toughie. To be honest, I didn't anticipate this. 
[2]Right, Lester. I heard you the first time. I'm not a dummy. 
[3]Look, I'm going back to my house to ponder this. So stay calm and keep track of Schwartz's comings and goings. Oh, and somebody dispose of Schwartz's wife, will you? Nice to meet you all. 
[4]It's open. 
[5]Have a seat. I wracking my brain over this Malkovich thing. 
[6]Vegas? What'd you think? 
[7]Impressions? Those are hard. 
[8]I suppose I could come to him in a dream. I don't know. That's the best I can think of right now. 
[9]No, a sexy dream. Of course, a scary dream. 
[10]I am the Devil. 
[11]Leave Malkovich. He is mine. 
[12]Shit. 
[13]No, for God's sake, I just watered it yesterday. It almost went well. I gave a pretty good dream, but circumstances arose. 
[14]Maxine says she'll leave him if he leaves Malkovich, plus he's been challenged to a puppet-duel by Mantini. 
[15]No, the Mediocre Mantini. Of course the Great Mantini! 
[16]But I think I have another plan. 
[17]Why are you being like this? 
[18]Well, if Mantini wins, Schwartz will leave Malkovich, right? So, if he needs it, I help Mantini's performance a bit, give him an edge. Spice up the show. 
[19]I am the Devil, Lester. I think I can handle it. 
[20]Fine. Let's drop it. 
[21]Fine. I'm not mad. Let's just drop it. 
[22]Bastard is stealing my thunder. 
[23]Okay, now! 
[24]One serpent, coming up.
dialogues.FLORIS:
[1]Welcome to LesterCorp. May we meet your filing needs? 
[2]Please have a seat, Mr. Juarez... 
[3]Pardon? 
[4]I'm sorry, I'm afraid I have no idea what you're saying right now. 
[5]Money, Miss Warts? 
[6]Fork ah did? 
[7]Mr. Juarez? 
[8]Yex? 
[9]You suggest what? I have no time for piddling suggestions from mumbling job applicants, my good man. Besides, Dr. Lester will see you now. I think that's what he said. 
[10]Gehginnis ondah foam? 
[11]Fork ah did? 
[12]You're good. 
[13]You're not like the other boys we've had here. Granted, I can't understand what you're saying either, but your soft palette resonates tremendously well and you never ever constrict your epiglottis. 
[14]Music to my ears! Whatever you said. Speak, speak, speak, my magnificent friend, speak! 
[15]Oh, what magic those fingers could work on the right cabinet. Alphabetize me, baby. And don't forget, I comes before U. 
[16]I'm afraid I... have no idea what you are saying... you bastard! 
[17]Someone names A Lot of Warts on line two. 
[18]Think, Jew florist? 
[19]Great things, my lonely subtext?
dialogues.MANTINI:
[1]Make one empty. 
[2]Nothing more than a Goddamn clown. 
[3]Hello, Schwartz. I saw your show. 
[4]Yeah, I saw them 
[5]Very impressive. I could use a producer with your vision. And other outstanding attributes. 
[6]We'll see, Schwartz. We'll see. 
[7]I won't waste your time Schwartz, or more importantly, mine. Here's my proposal: There's only room in this world for one "World's Greatest Puppeteer."  Correct? So let's allow the puppet-going public to crown their king. 
[8]A friendly competition, if you will. Your Malkovich puppet and my Harry S. Truman puppet appear opposite each other in a play. Not some Vegas Burly-Q pyrotechnics, but a real play that requires actual acting. The audience decides who is more deserving of the title. The losing puppeteer bows out graciously. Goes back to obscurity as a file clerk. 
[9]Say... "Equus"? It's got everything. 
[10]Broadway's finest three hours. It's about the suppression of the individual. Conformity as God in modern society. 
[11]Nothing but acting to hide behind, buddy-boy. 
[12]Great then. 
[13]No. 
[14]I can't wait to see where you and your friends live, Lotte.
dialogues.ERROLL:
[1]Hello, I'm here about the ad. 
[2]When you say, I can be somebody else, what do you mean exactly? 
[3]Oh, this is just the medical breakthrough I've been waiting for. Are their any side effects? Please say no! Please say no! 
[4]Long term psychic or physiological repercussions? 
[5]Can I be anyone I want? 
[6]Well that's perfect. My second choice. Ah, this is wonderful. Too good to be true! You see, I'm a sad man. Sad and fat and alone. Oh, I've tried all the diets, my friends. Lived for a year on nothing but imitation mayonnaise. Did it work? You be the judge. But Malkovich! King of New York! Man about town! Most eligible bachelor! Bon Vivant! The Schopenhauer of the 20th century! Thin man extraordinaire! 
[7]Yes. Yes. A thousand times, yes! 
[8]Oh, thank you! Thank you! Thousand times, thank you! 
[9]Oh, I will, and I have many, many friends and associates, my friend. All, by the way, in Overeaters Anonymous. All of them fat and alone like me, all of them dream of being someone else, all of them with John Malkovich as their second choice!
dialogues.CABBIE:
[1]Say, aren't you that actor guy? 
[2]John Makel... 
[3]Mapplethorpe? 
[4]Malkovich! 
[5]Yeah. I liked you in that one movie. 
[6]The one where you're that jewel thief. 
[7]Who am I thinking of? 
[8]I'm pretty sure it was you. Hey, could I get your autograph now? It's for .... oh, what the hell, it's for me! I'm your biggest fan!
dialogues.AGENT:
[1]Of course, send him right in. Don't ever keep him waiting again. Do you understand? 
[2]John! Great to see you! Sorry about the cunt at reception. 
[3]Great to see you, Maxine. Sorry about the cunt at reception. Please have a seat. 
[4]Can I get you anything? Coffee? Water? 
[5]Teresa, get me a chicken soup. Chicken soup? 
[6]Okay. 
[7]Oh yeah, he's good. 
[8]Sure, sure. Just let me make a couple of calls.
dialogues.KEVIN BACON:
[1]I'm sure you're not going crazy. 
[2]Yeah yeah yeah. Yadda yadda yadda. Were you stoned? 
[3]You were stoned. Case closed. End of story. How hot is this babe? 
[4]Ouch. Now that's hot. She's using you to channel some dead lesbian lover. Let me know when you're done with her. This is my type of chick. 
[5]You're crazy to let go of a chick who calls you Lotte. I tell you that as a friend. 
[6]All the better. Hey, Hot Lesbian Witches, next Geraldo, buddy boy. Ha ha ha. 
[7]The truth is for suckers, Johnny-Boy.
dialogues.WOMAN #1:
[1]Seven and a half, right? 
[2]I'll take you through it. 
[3]Seven and a half. 
[4]You don't look a day over one hundred and five, Captain. What's your secret? 
[5]Do we get to wear a crown? 
[6]Count me in.
dialogues.DON:
[1]Hello. Wendy. 
[2]It's an interesting story, Wendy. Many years ago in the late 1800's, James Mertin, an Irish ship captain looking to invest in the future of our great country, came to this town and decided to erect an office building. 
[3]So that's the story of 7 1/2. Since the rents are considerably lower this floor has been adopted by businesses which for one reason or another are forced to cut corners After all... the overhead is low! Ha ha ha! 
[4]Hi. Wendy! What're you up to in this vacant office. 
[5]That's right, Wendy, it is against floor policy, but as long as you're here, let me tell you what I know about our cute little door friend. Many years ago, this very office was occupied by a kindly old watchmaker named Mr. White. 
[6]Truth is stranger than fiction, Wendy!
dialogues.PETER:
[1]Good food, Lotte. 
[2]Vegetarian, right? 
[3]Amazing. 
[4]No kidding about that 7 1/2 floor. Craig? 
[5]How many? 
[6]I wonder why so many.
